titleStmt.title: The Downe-fall of Dagon, or, the taking downe of Cheap-side crosse this second of May, 1643. wherein is contained these principalls following, viz. First, Cheapside crosse sick at the heart. Secondly, his death and funerall. Thirdly, his will, legacies, inventory and epitaph. Fourthly, the reason why it was taken downe, and the authority for it. Fiftly, the benefit and profit that is made of the materialls of it, and the severall summes of mony which is offered for it; likewise the satisfaction it will give to thousands of people. Sixtly notes worthy of the readers observation, that the crosse should just happen to bee taken downe on that day which crosses were first invented and set up.

notesStmt.note: Woodcut of Cheapside cross on t.p.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
